content: @Michel Rutten Noticed a change in Forge this morning, I suspect it is correct (and intentional)- the root element for an extension (path == "Extension") is no longer included in the differential, unless the properties of it have changed.
@Jonny Rylands indeed, although this is not an intentional change. Thank you for pointing this out. I'll discuss this with Ewout to verify if the current behavior is valid.

@Jonny Rylands Ewout confirmed that in DSTU 2, the differential component must ALWAYS contain a root element definition. In DSTU 3 this is no longer required. I will update Forge to ensure that the root element definition is always serialized to the output Xml, regardless of any changes.
That's interesting, thanks. Do you know when DSTU 3 is planned for?
DSTU 3 will go to ballot this August, with the hope to publish it before the end of 2016
thanks, is there anywhere I can look to see the changes planned for DSTU 3?
You can look at the "current" build here: http://hl7-fhir.github.io/
Obviously there will be more changes coming between now and August.
You can look at the FHIR gForge tracker to see some of the proposed changes.
